channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What credit score do you need to buy a house?
item.description: Mortgage lenders use specific credit scores—here are the minimum scores you need for a variety of mortgage types.

item.title: The America trade: These stocks highly exposed to the U.S. are primed to outperform
item.description: These stocks with strong exposure could have further room to run, analysts say.

item.title: U.S. stock and bond markets close early today — here’s what you need to know
Fourth of July traffic will be record-setting. Here’s how to avoid the traffic jams
item.description: Nearly 71 million people will be traveling.

item.title: This 'bucket strategy' could lower your taxes in retirement — here's how to maximize it
item.description: Most Americans aren't planning to reduce taxes on retirement income. Here's how the "bucket strategy" could help, experts say.

item.title: Southwest Airlines adopts ‘poison pill’ to ward off hostile-takeover prospect
Looking for the coming tide of economic growth? Start here
item.description: As the world ages, businesses need to seize the potential of older workers and consumers.

item.title: Vice President Kamala Harris' past donors privately strategize in case Biden drops out
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' allies discuss scenarios in the event that President Joe Biden decides not to keep his reelection campaign going.

item.title: ISM data show sharpest U.S. business contraction since pandemic
Elon Musk vows Bill Gates will be ‘obliterated’ if he doesn’t stop shorting Tesla
item.description: If the Optimus robot somehow catapults Tesla to Musk’s $30 trillion market cap target, bears like the Microsoft cofounder could be wiped out—but that is a big if.

item.title: Social Security cost-of-living adjustment may be lower in 2025. These charts help show why
item.description: Even though inflation has subsided, many retirees are still feeling the pinch of high prices. Data shows the Social Security COLA may be lower in 2025.

item.title: U.S. factory orders drop after three straight monthly rises
Paramount merger with Skydance back on under new terms following collapse of talks
item.description: National Amusements, the family company that controls Paramount, will refer the deal to a special committee of Paramount directors for review.

item.title: Millions of student loan borrowers to see their bills lowered in July — here's what else to know
item.description: The Biden administration's new repayment plan for student loan borrowers is facing legal challenges. Here's what relief borrowers can still expect.

item.title: S&P 500 holds its ground atop 5,500 after soft job-creation data — live coverage
